name: Morphopolis
description: Morphopolis is about transformation and discovery. Morphopolis takes you on a puzzle adventure through a fantastical insect world. Starting as an aphid grub, you embark on an epic journey of metamorphosis toward your spawning ground.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Core 2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / 8 Processor: Intel i3 Memory: 4 GB RAM Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Nice as an art gallery, but awful as a game. The bugs move reeeeaally slowly. I know how fast bugs move in real life. I have seen them. Why do they move so slowly here? There's no reason other than to draw out the gameplay way longer than it needs to be. The game isn't very good at letting you know what you can and can't do. The only way to move is to hold your mouse down in the direction you want to go, but you can only go along preset paths, and some of the screens are in places that don't even look like paths and feel like you'd only ever find them on accident. It's basically a glorified hidden object game, except everything is so vibrant that the stuff you have to pick out doesn't tend to stand out enough. There were a few instances where I wasn't even sure what exactly I was looking for.  The minigames are generally alright, though there's two that are abnormally challenging compared to the rest of the game. The flower bud puzzle especially, which is painful both because of the puzzle itself and the fiddly controls. It's very short. 5 small 'levels'. No real connecting story except that you play as the creature you helped in the previous level, and at the end you open a door and then the screen just fades out. Abrupt. The game looks very pretty and sounds pretty nice too, I'll give it that, but it's slow and frustrating for what should be a relaxing experience, and not worth the money for what little gameplay is given to the player.

Morphopolis is a gorgeous P&C game bringing you through the life of a bug that morphs into other forms as it completes its journey. Where that journey goes exactly, is not really known, but you will point and click your way through several beautifully designed levels, finding hidden objects to unlock puzzles and continue onto the next stage.  The music is rather relaxing and don't get old too quickly but after a long while, you may just want to mute it and play your own music instead.   The puzzles aren't too hard but will require a bit of your brain to solve.  My biggest gripe is control. As you are controlling your little critter around, sometimes it gets confused or locks up and goes back and forth back and forth cause it doesn't really know what you want. Instead of pointing and clicking and your creature going there, you have to hold it, and not al paths are self-evident.   The game moves at a very slow pace, so if you're not in a realxed mood, don't bother to play it or you might get frustrated with the slow speed. Personally I think the game has no replay value, but for such a cheap game, did you really expect any?  Overall 6/10 - Get it on sale for an interesting mix of art, music and puzzles.

Among all the games in the recent Indie Royale Soapsuds bundle, this game is the cream of the crop. Morphopolis is a nature and ambient (casual) puzzle game. It features vibrant art and combined with some cool puzzles. The game has you search for items hidden all over the screen in order to progress further. Some of the items are actually hidden quite well. After obtaining the items, you are then subjected to a few unique puzzles in each area (a total of 5 areas). The puzzles were well-made and felt just about right. They were neither too easy nor too hard. Overall the game took me about 2 hours but that was definitely 2 hours well spent.  4/5
Published by: Dan Walters Developed by: Dan Walters, Ceri Williams Genre: Hidden Object, Point & Click, Puzzle Release Date: August 14, 2014 Time to complete: 90 minutes   Introduction

Since I'm already a fanatic about the insect world, I was bound from the beginning to love the game. The art style and the colors are gorgeous, and it's a great little point-and-click and object search game. For people who care about game length, this game is pretty short - it only took me 1.7 hours to get through the whole thing. The pathfinding was a little arduous at times, but not intolerably so. Big bonus, of course, is steam cards.
A whole new level of your insectophobia.

To me this was just a ♥♥♥♥♥ier version of Tiny Bang Story. The walking around is cumbersome and mind-numbingly boring. The puzzles are somehow both generic and confusing. It took me like five ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to figure out one of the puzzles was checkers because it was the first time I had to click and drag in the entire game and it didn't tell me dragging was a thing.  It's cheap, but even if it was free I'd go back and not waste my time on it.

Finally, the game which has a charm of telling arts, relaxing sounds and possessive gameplay for those in the contemplative mood!  Just time passing and observation lets you discover the goal and way to reach it.
Not my type of game... Its like a point and click game you would play in a bar.

Interesting concept of the game. Hidden object is the most accurate description, but it certainly isn't a standard game from that genre. There is no story and still you can follow the 'plot' pretty easily.  The presentation is unique and the music fits the atmosphere nicely. The animations aren't perfect, but again fit the style of the game very well. The controls aren't that great and guessing where to go and/or how to get there can be a bit frustrating. The controls just work well enough to finish the game, but you will run into some problems with them.  Another small issue is that you have to move between screens and it is awfully slow. It's a design decision to include this 'mechanic' into the game, but I don't think that it works particularly well. Still it only slows the rather short game down, so it's really not much of an issue.  Is the game worth to play? Yes. Is it worth 5$? Well, no. It is quite short and offers no replay value, so get it in a sale or from a bundle. That being said try to get in the next proper sale, as it is a worthwhile experience :)

A beatifully drawn game with an equally beautiful soundtrack. I can recommend Morphoplis if you are looking for a serene experience of clicking hidden objects and solving puzzles. It is let down somewhat by the slow and clunky movement in the game, but given how simple the gameplay is, I can excuse it. The first time I played it though, I couldn't work out even the basic movement, which is essentially point in a particular direction and hold down the mouse button.   There are only certain paths you can follow through the foliage, and it's soon obvious where these paths are. The learning curve of working out what on earth you are supposed to be doing in this garden somehow adds to the dreamlike quality of the scenery, and there are no textual or spoken cues to stop you thinking like an insect interacting in its natural environment.  You should come to Morphopolis with a relaxed frame of mind, because otherwise you could get easily frustrated. It's the gaming equivalent of getting in touch with nature and living among the flowers. It is a very short, casual game, but leaves its mark on you, showing what else games can be than blood-thirsty war games.
Gorgeous graphics and a relaxing soundtrack. A nice way to spend a couple of hours.

Ok, i just finished this litle gem, in about 70-80 mins, taking my time to see the amazing artwork  As said by other reviews this is essentially a hidden object game with some easy puzzles. The music is amazing and completes its theme. Definately worth to buy on sale even if you are not big fun of this genre. I only wish it was longer!  The only negative i can think of is the fact that if you want the steam cards you have to leave it open and running without any other game launched, after you have finished it. (lol)

I feel very sorry that I got this game with a ridiculous discount of 95% - Anyway, get this game immediately and play it fort two hours until its end. It is great. It is beautiful. It is neither too difficult, nor too easy.

Visually, this game is nice. Control and documentation/instructions, this game is not so good.  I picked this up on sale for $0.19 USD during Steam Summer Sale 2015. The value of the entertainment provided is at least worth a dollar, so this was in my opinion a good value.  This is basically a hidden object/click and find game with a few puzzles thrown in. There are 5 levels. A short game, but fun enough. The puzzles are a nice easy casual level. The hidden object portion is clunky. You usually have at least two different screens to look for your objects. Your insect starts in one corner of a screen, you click and hold to tell it where to go. You have a hint box in the upper right corner. You can use it if you get a bit lost. It takes time to replenish. The insect moves slow and the paths are not always clear/easy to navigate. You spend a lot of time going back and forth.  Some of the puzzles are not so evident as far as what you're supposed to do. For example, there is a puzzle that is basically a peg game. You have a grid of objects with the center unoccupied. You need to jump one object over another to remove it from the grid. Repeat until you only have one object remaining. Pretty simple. The problem was that there were no instructions telling you how to do this. You need to click and hold then drag. Artifact of being a mobile app/game for a touch screen?  The background music, is just that, background music. It's not an epic fighting game, it's a puzzle game, so the music is repetitive new age sounding instrumentals. Easy to ignore, but really, nothing bad.  Overall, get it on sale and it's worth a few minutes of distraction.

Picked this game up for £0.15 and it's given me a nice 2 hours of gameplay.  Gorgeous graphics and I enjoyed the point and click puzzle elements.  The only frustrating bit is that the puzzles have no instructions and the hint button doesn't work when you are completing one so the first bit of many of the puzzles is clicking around the screen to try and get something to work. Also if you quit halfway through a level it doesn't save it for you.  It's a nice game whilst it's on sale but I don't think I would have purchased it full price.

Every once in a while one needs a game where he can just shut down, listen to some relaxing music and enjoying nicely drawn art.  Morphopolis is short, but its definitely worth it's price.  There isn't really much else to say about it... hiddeon object game, some small riddles. Soothes the nerves.  Really, you have to see on your ow instead of reading a review. All I can say it: It's nice.
Broke the game on the second level. Had the grass hoper move up, but the screen didn't scroll. After that any time I clicked a little bell would chime. Best game ever.

I really like the idea of this game but alas I can not play it. I have a wide screen setup and it will not work correctly under my configuration. If the game had an options menu and I could go into windowed mode that would fix it and I'd be happy with it. There is no configuration options in this game at all! Add a configuration menu with the option to go into windowed mode (or implement alt+tab to toggle between full-screen and windowed mode) and I'll come back to this game, otherwise it's unplayable to me and many others I have read in the forums having similar issues.
Atmospheric point and click puzzle game
A straight forward puzzle game with crazy 60's psychedelic graphics. Very short, but fun enough to play.  It's 24c at the moment, and worth 10x that.  7/10.

This is a pretty cool game. Not only is it aesthetically pleasing, but it's somewhat simple. No language or readable instructions - just a cookie crumb trail of hints.   What I got from it is this: You're a good little bug (and later become bigger bug) that goes around trying to help other bugs by giving back their appendages, planting eggs, putting leaves on plants, etc.    Best $0.19 I've spent. Get it.
Great, relaxing game.

An amazing and small little game with Beutiful artwork and soothing soundtrack, this game is amazing but is a little more of clicking everywhere to find stuff. I reccomend this game BUT only if its on discount.     PROS -Amazing Music -Amazing Art -Nice Puzzles   CONS -Click Simulator -Some puzzles are very vague -Click everywhere   You have to buy this game if its on discount.
10/10 music 10/10 joy Great 2 hours of chilling
This game is so calming. Great art and the music just suit the enviroment. Simply beautiful.
Thanks for no saves. Played for an hour, get tired an closed the game. What did I see when come back? Too boring

Beautiful and charming small puzzle game. I've really enjoyed the calming trip through five maps, full of very detailed, wonderful handdrawn art and hypnotic music, In terms of gameplay this is mostly a hidden object game, with some classic sliding puzzles here and there, varying from easy to tricky. The sometimes troublesome controls, double walking pathes and the lack of real originality in puzzles could weaken my overall very positive impression, but somehow they don't do and I'm sure I will replay this at some point!
Good little 6+ casual game. :D

Wow, what an amazing game!   I just bought Morphopolis today, it was very cheap on sale and the game was an amazing experience.  You play as an insect and you have to salvage other insects that are dead or almost dead, not quite sure about that. To do so you have to solve puzzles. Most of them are easy except the very last one.  Beautiful graphics, nice music and the fact that the game does not guide you is a plus in this case. This games makes it fun to find out what you have to do. But you need a little patience. Morphopolis is not for restless players. And it's short, you can finish the game in about 2.5 hours.
What a gorgeous little game! :)  Very short but certainly affordable. Plus.. THEM ARTWORKS! <3  Recommended.

Pretty, bordering on the surreal. Enchanting music. No tutorial, you just need to figure out things for yourself. The game is a cross between an art project, a point and click adventure, and a hidden object game, as you take your insect on a journey through 5 levels of undergrowth. The puzzles fit the theme, and while some are easy, others are trickier due to no instructions. The final puzzle made me rip my hair out before I finally managed it. The game is short, at just around 2 hours, but the price is unbeatable. At full price, it's worth it, but you can usually pick it up for just a few cents. At the time of writing, it's only 24 cents! It makes it worth buying just to try it, even if you don't think you'll like it. Recommended!

Morphopolis is an 'art game' if ever there was one. I say that because I believe for this particular game the art is the priority. That's not to say there isn't interaction but its gameplay is quite simple. I'd go as far to say that the gameplay is designed to make sure you focus on and absorb the art. The eye candy is nice but it takes more then that to design a good game.  In Morphopolis you play as different bugs who are kind enough to help out there neighbors with different chores. Then at the end of each stage it appears you transfer yourself into a larger bug whom you'll play as in the following stage. There isn't any written story instead the game leaves it up to you to interrupt the meaning behind you're actions. Even beyond story-telling there isn't even guides to tell you where to go or what to do. Restricted movement and actions is enough to let you figure out for yourself what you need to accomplish.  This game is super stylized. The consistency of the art work between each stage is spot on. The stages split across multiple screens which connect seamlessly. The art is this Morphopolis is stunning. The paintings are incredible and make you really focus when trying to find the objects you need. You'll be looking at every little detail as your eyes slowly inspect the image.  Essentially, this is a find the objects game. As you play you'll come across particular plants and bugs that stick out from the backgrounds. Each of them will ask you to find a set amount of particular items for them. You'll need to carefully scan the backgrounds and gather up all the items. Then proceed to deliver them in order to clear a path or initiate a special mini-game puzzle. All the puzzles are very different and I believe this is were Morphopolis loses it consistency. Until this point the game is fairly easy and relaxing but a couple of the puzzles are incredibly challenging. This very bizarre difficulty curve takes you out of what is otherwise an immersive and enjoyable game.  Very stylized and original, the only thing holding this game back from is it's struggle balancing. If you think this might be a game you'll enjoy don't let that hold you back. That being said I'm sure some people will really enjoy that added challenge. Those who are worried about getting frustrated can always minimize the game a bring up walk-through for the really tough puzzles. As I said before art is at the core of this game. This is an array of visual stimulation that will let you relax and lose yourself in the world. Look else where for a more interactive and more traditional 'game like' experience.

This game is beautiful! The artwork is amazing and vibrant! The insect movement is smooth and the music is really soothing. The puzzles are pretty easy up until the very last one. It took me about 30 minutes to finish... I knew what needed to be done, but I couldnt make my brain see it. In the end it was a matter of luck. I dont count that against the game at all... it really made me feel like I had accomplished something. I recommend this game if you like soothing hidden object games with a bit of puzzle element thrown in.

I really wanted to enjoy this short little game (I'm a fan of Tiny Bang Story) but the lack of even basic control instructions makes the experience far more frustrating than fun. Each level has one mini-game that you must complete to continue. However, there are no indications of any kind to tell you what you are supposed to do in the mini-game, and much worse, there is no exit button from the level! You must tab out to the desktop then use Task Manager to close the game. That is horrible game design!   At least Morphopolis is very cheap so you won't feel like a fool for spending too much money if you become frustrated to the point of quitting before finishing.
Great game. Love the music!
Thought I was on drugs Oh wait, I am. Never mind. Good game. What is life...
Good point&click game, for low price you can get a few time to spend with colorful nature, guessing what should you do next to continue exploring this little world. Enjoy the atmosphere.
Extremely pretty, relaxing. Paid $.50 for the game, definitely got my money's worth.

Would recommend - according to how one answers this questions.  1. Do you like the art style from the screenshots?  Yes? Proceed to 2. No? Do not buy.  2. Do you like point-and-click games?  Yes? Proceed to 3. No? Do not buy.  3. Do you like hints?  Yes. Do not buy. No? Proceed to 4.  4. Is it on sale?  Yes. Buy the darn thing! No. Wait for sale.   It's a nice little game, but very short, and a little bare-bones. (no menu to get out of a minigame screen, had to kill process). It is honestly a very well polished flash game. However the art is so great, and the music so lovely that I think it's worth a few dollars. Maybe not five, but that is up to you.

More clunky Tiny Bang Story. Moving between screens is awkward and a little frustrating and one of the puzzles in level 2 doesnt make any sense to me at all, but it's playable, has a nice OST, and that surreal feeling of games like Botanicula and Tiny bang Story.

A simple point and click game. Gorgeus graphics and a relaxing soundtrack. Acquire fruit, mushrooms and severed bug limbs to morph into the dead carcass of a bigger bug. Includes some puzzles, so you will need to poke your brain a bit. 8/10
PRO: - setting / graphics - riddles  CON: - about 1.5 hours to finish - more levels would be nice  NEUTRAL: - casual / to relax - no hints / tutorial / etc

This game is weird. It's lovely and great fun, but the bug culture being represented is just really weird. You play a bug in each level who gathers parts to rebuild a dead or dying bug and make it your new body (?). I'm not sure if that's what it's about, but that's what I'm going to believe it's about. This game is certainly fun. I don't like the lack of direction in the puzzle mini-games.
This made me want to kill myself

This is a neat little game in which you are an insect, morphing through different stages of your life. Very creative concept, like many other cheap games on the store. Not a ton of content, but I bought it for 19 cents, so it's alright.
♥♥♥♥♥ my eyes more than   gay porn    Gud game. Great puzzle. Much wow

This game only took two hours for me to complete, which made me pay roughly €0.09 per hour, which I got back by gaining three cards which can be sold for roughly €0.2~, buit I would have spent €5 for this game, and here’s why.  First off, there’s no real option menu, which annoyed me at first since there’s no way to change the volume nor a real interface. Clearly this is more suited for an iPad where you can sit and relax with just your index finger but I’m so happy that I played it on 1920x1080p since the graphics are amazing. The artstyle is colorful and it helps when it comes to how the puzzles are built, forcing you to admire the artstyle while playing. This game is slowing down the pace, forcing you to actually study the environment in search for clues or hidden key all while listening to a wonderful soundtrack that’s soothing and mysterious at the same time.  There’s a downside though, the controls can be clunky and the insect you’re playing is moving so slow which makes it mildly infuriating when it comes to running back and forward when it comes to solving puzzles. Yet, this was an amazing gaming experience, and this is coming from someone who usually ignores the puzzles and ragequit while pretending to be intellectually superior since I haven’t let the game prove me wrong.  HIGHLY recommend.

I thoroughly enjoyed the experience of playing Morphopolis. The concept was pretty straight-forward and the puzzles were stimulating enough without being too over-demanding. I actually found it easy to unwind whilst playing this - the colours and sounds created a soothing effect. Morphopolis was compared somewhere to The Room (another game I loved immensely). My experience of the two games differed in that I completed Morphopolis in one sitting, whilst with The Room I reached several points where I became stuck and had to take a break before resuming. When I played Morphopolis there were five levels and they didn't take too long to get through. It would be nice if more levels were added or a follow-up released.  This is a great game and I highly recommend it to anyone.
♥♥♥♥♥ my eyes more than   gay porn    Gud game. Great puzzle. Much wow

You a bug.  This point and click adventure game about being an insect and finding pieces to advance into the levels and fix your friend so you can become them. kind of.  5 unique levels as different insects and new areas offers a relaxing time for children and adults looking for a slow, stress relieving game. This game has ambient music and pretty, colourly art that lightens up the game.   Remember: If you leave anywhere in a level without completing it, you will need to start over. There are no checkpoints.  The game is simple to play, relatively straightforward (some instructions are missing which slowed down gameplay even further) and has 8 puzzles of different skill levels (4 easy / 1 normal / 3 hard)  It has a decent help system with a button you can press for the next objectives location that recharges over time. Sometimes instructions are no clear and will leave you guessing and clicking everything on screen to get to the next location. The game can feel like it takes forever due to the slow game progression and the constant walking between zones. Negative or positive I leave that up to you.  Puzzles are not explained very well, so some of them can be hard or difficult not because of the puzzle itself but the lack of information going into the task.  Its a nice relaxing, colourful artsy puzzle game for the child at heart.   It's only 1$ and has about 2 hours of gameplay.  Personal Rating: 3/5

I recommend this game only for people looking to get an easy 100% achievement game and some trading cards. I got it for $0.24, and at that price it was worth it to me for the achievements and the cards.  This is a fairly easy puzzle game. There was only one puzzle (the last one) that I considered difficult. I found the controls for moving my insect (point and click with mouse) to be annoying. Most of the time you are looking for hidden objects on the screen. After finding the required objects on each level, there is then a puzzle or two to move on. There are five levels. It's very casual, there are no real risks or ways to mess anything up. You just keep trying until you find the objects or solve the puzzle. Maybe about 2 hours of total gameplay for 100% achievements, possibly longer if you get stuck on some of the puzzles.

Pretty pictures and relaxing music, but it's a Hidden Object 'game' interspersed with occasional abstract Myst-style puzzles. The artwork is pretty but it's extremely poor at highlighting the objects you're supposed to click - so poor that the game has to throw up giant flashing Click Here Next Arrows, which render the 'game' portion completely pointless.  Bottom line, it's great at being a screensaver, but pretty awful at being a game. Considering the low price, I'd vote 'neutral' if such a concept were allowed.

A very pretty waste of time.  Every second I play this 'Game' feels like I paid for pretty art rather than intresting gameplay.  It has a find all the hidden objects style of play that I hate.  So if you are intrested in all flash, and no substance than get this game, I just don't enjoy it.
My dead grandma is more responsitive than this game controls

morphopolis is one game that you enjoy visually and mentally. the sound also does make it feel like you are in jungle. pro: 1. Buy it with bundle, is cheap. 2. Have Trading Cards. 3. Puzzle is great, don't use walkthrough first time and just enjoy the game. 4. You can get perfect Achievement.  cons: 1. Nothing really, unless you can't stand seeing bugs
Freezes up; puzzles don't always work; not worth my time.
This game is a waste of time. Puzzles are very simple and obvious, the biggest challenge is to find the hidden items which is not fun at all - it's frustrating. I definitely do not recommend.
A 2 hours journey of metamorphosis. Very gorgeous art design, good music, relaxing gameplay. Basically a steal.
Very hard, rage-inducing  10/10~Blob

2/10  Sorry I know a LOT of work I could never do went into this game, but I just wouldn't recommend it.  Things I Liked  - The soothing music. - The art. - A couple of the puzzles were a challenge. -   The Idea of the next stage being controlling the insect that ate the previous bug you played as.    Things I Didn't Like  - The controls. I was sat slumped in my chair holding the mouse button watching my bug crawl agonisingly slowly across the screen.  - The gamplay. Aside form the puzzles, most of the gameplay is based around looking at the screen to spot things to collect in order to progress. - The hint question mark in the top corner really stood out as looking unfinished against the lovely vibrant level design. - After stage 2 (of 5) I was hoping for a new element to come and wake me up, but it never did.

I fairly short point and click at around 90 minutes for 100%. Movement of your bug character is slow and only moves along set paths. Despite the poor controls and lack of story (there is none really), I found the game to be quite enjoyable. At full price it doesn't really meet my $1/hour rule but if you can get it on sale pick it up. Also note cards do not seem to drop.
Looks very nice, I'm telling you this because I'm nice and i just said it's nice, so now I'm even nicer.

When i opened the game i was comfused becouse game looked to me weird. After playing it for 10 minutes i started to like it becouse it has a lot of funny mini-games and you need to find objects so you can pass the level. Its pretty good when to play it when you are nervous :). 8.5/10

if you have patience and you like puzzel and HoG games, this one is for you! I am in part 3 and until now it's not difficult to solve puzzles and find hidden objects. And i bought it for 0,24 cents, so buy it !  The negative thing is that you can't save anything, you just have to finish each level, otherwise you have to do it all over again.
If it's on sale, you can get cards, and basically play the game for free, and the game is quite good.  10/10

A very simple & short puzzle/hide & seek game. Took a little over 2hours to complete start to finish. Would be much quicker if I wasn't colourblind so the last level was a hit & miss for me.  However, for the sale price of 15p and easy to obtain 100% achievements it's fun while it last's.  Nice vibrant colours & has a beautiful soundtrack to it to make it an even more relaxing game. ^^
beautiful and relaxing game that's kinda hidden object+puzzle. no more than 2 hours to complete
I haven't played it yet.             What? You expect me to play interactive art? Do you think this is a game??

It was one big fault to buy this game. It may have been cheap but it are'nt worth the money.  Pros: Nice artwork Nice idea for a puzzlegame  Cons: You move slow as f*** The game is too short Some of the puzzles are inpossible  Sorry but i really regret buying this game.

not doing your ♥♥♥♥ing puzzles game. not four minutes in. not ones i can permanently ♥♥♥♥ up on. not ones that are giant boards that you have to switch pieces around that move at their own leisure. not gonna ♥♥♥♥ing do it. nope.  TL:DR: mlg puzzlers only

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through.' I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

Thought it was gonna be a cute hidden object/ive game, was plesantly surprised by the bizzare aspects of it. The objectives and puzzles are pretty straight forward, only two parts weren't as clear as they should be instruction-wise. and by that I mean the pollen exchange nodes (there aren't any cues to jump over and that you can jump around the edges too) and the stick bug bridge (his cammoflage was too good lol).  Would definitely play a longer version :D  Also, amazing soundtrack!!

This is a very plesant short game. Relaxing music, fun puzzles, very pretty art work and a very reasonable price. The game wasn't too hard but wasn't too easy and really made you think at times. Over all, it is a great game. One thing I really liked about it is how you can get all the achievements from one play through. No need to go through monotonous stuff just to unlock and achievement.   Would I recommend the game? Definitally. The game has been over all a pleasurable experience and missing an oppertunity to play such a beautiful game would be a let down.

The graphic art, illustration and aesthetics are very good. The puzzles are interesting. The music is not bad, the loops could be longer. That's the good thing about the game. Its gameplay is mediocre, the animation is basic and not very good. They are only 5 levels. I recommend buying one if you are in and their cards offer traiding.  El arte grafico, la ilustración y la estética estan muy bien. Los puzzles son interesantes. La música no esta mal, los loops podrían ser mas largos. Eso es lo bueno que tiene el juego. Su jugabilidad es mediocre, la animacion es basica y no muy buena. Son solo 5 niveles. Recomiendo comprarlo solo si esta en oferta y por sus traiding cards.

Morphopolis is a very short game, but I really enjoyed it. For the first few moments, I was frustrated, but then you have that 'aha' satisfaction for figuring out the mechanisms without being told. Yes, there is a lot of moving back and forth. But the soundtrack is lovely, the visuals are delightful, and it was a very relaxing experience. I do wish there were more levels, though. I finished the game too quickly to even get one card drop (which isn't a big deal for me but gives a sense of how short it is). Definitely consider it if you like puzzle games and it's on sale.
It's short, the characters move awkwardly, and the puzzles are mostly pretty simple. It's pretty-ish, but the art seems to get in the way of the game at times.

3/5 A Visual and Relaxing hour.  Morphoplis is a point and click hidden object/puzzle game.   VERY EASY. Don't expect much of a challange. The game is more about experiencing the artwork and ralaxing story line. There are no time limits and no lives. Just play and explore the art.   You only need a mouse to play, and it should take about an hour to get through all 5 levels. No story really, just play along.  I wouldn't pay more than 50 cents on the game; but for that, it's worth it.
Love it!
Wow ! Surreal Bug's life   Remind me to 'Fantastic Planet' Movie awww  7.5/10
Its a cute little puzzle game with good music and good artstyle!  I recommend this game if you want to pass the time.  Only downside, i wish this game was a little longer..
This is a very short and quick game, but the price reflects it. Some of the pathing in this game is a bit off, but the beauty of the art more than makes up for it.

I did like this game but I probably wouldn't play it again after finishing it. Moving each bug through the 5 levels was really painful in parts, your path is invisible and if you happen to drag or click your mouse elsewhere your bug will move into the next scene before you're ready, so you have to go back again... this happened quite a few times.  Extra points for puzzles I haven't seen before in other click and points, but that very last puzzle... another painful aspect.  Overall a very beautiful game, wasn't as relaxing for me since I found the haphazard movements very annoying. Wasn't worth full price for me, had I bought it on sale I might be more positive about it.
It's a very cute point and click game. The art is very vibrant and colorful. The puzzle isn't too hard even without any instuctions. Totally worth it!

nice point and click with good soundtrack and beautiful artstyle, probably most comfortable to play with touchscreen but mouse works ok. quite short, 5 levels each with a few gathering puzzles and 1 or 2 special puzzles. interacting with other living forms in the world reminds me of scribblenauts mechanics a bit.

If you are like me, impatient, you really REALLY won´t like this game. +It´s graphics are pretty good, some puzzles are very challenging, game would be nice for kids I guess, and the concept of the game is good. -Your character (a bug) is pretty slow, sometimes you keep switching between screens because of the controls.  The reason I do not recommend this game is because of that 1.9hrs on record, 0.70 hrs are all of moving my character.

I want to like this game but I cant get past the incredible annoyance the point/click (hold left mouse button forever) mechanic caused me. Competly took me out of what would've been an extremely plesent experience. Not to mention that this annoyance is blown out of proportion by the makers not providing any sort of instruction any puzzle save the first inital scene. What was wonder and happiness turned to bitter yelling due to the same mouse button being used to move as to click on mission items causing you to move everytime you went to click on anything, its hard to explain with words, but once you get to the second level, you will understand. The speed at which the characters walk it is absurdly slow at points, adds to the rage of accidently exiting to a different screen.  Decent in-game ambient music, a bit too serene for my liking, but it has its charm, quite possibly worth the purchase for the music and art itself. Entertaining game just stressful for people who like to the point games (myself included).   NOT INTEDED FOR PEOPLE WHO SUFFER FROM HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE AND QUICK TEMPERS, YOU COULD POSSIBLY DIE!!!!
Amazing Art Style but the controls and gameplay is funky and boring, it's fun when you're bored AF. 7/10
Well this game is pure art in my opinion.  Nothing more to say.  10/10
Great arts

Fun and relaxing. Controls are at times a bit clunky, but if you like a combo of finding hidden things in pictures coupled with a few hard puzzles as essentially 'boss battles,' then you should enjoy this title.

For $2, you receive an outstanding little game that while only lasting around 2 hours is incredibly relaxing to play and beautiful to look at with a great atmosphere soundtrack listen to.  There's really not more too say. A brilliant bug-sized experience worth every cent.  When this game goes on sale for $0.19, do NOT hesitate to buy it!

This was a fantastic short game to play on the side. I found it challenging enough, but it is only 5 levels long.   A lot of the negative reviews complain about it being difficult to find things. (well no $^!#). 'Back in my day, I had to walk 50 miles to the store in my barefeet just to look up cheats and strategies....
hard :cc
It is very VERY slow paced, and the puzzles are fustrating.  The puzzles are not hard but fustratingly slow to go through each phase.
One of the most terrible 'games' I've ever seen. It's almost worse than Bad Rats.

If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on ! Napoleon from the final puff pastry  You will need:  Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

One of the most beautiful games I have played. The layout itself it's a great piece of art. The armony of the colours, the balance of the music and the speed with which you move takes you to a state of peace. As for the game itself, you play as a bug trying to collect flowers, mushrooms or other insects as required. For every collection you complete, you must solve a puzzle, mostly graphic ones. You have to finish each of the 5 levels in one playthrough, since you can't save your progress, but that's quite fine since they don't take so long. You can complete the game in 1 or 2 hours the most, but it's totally worth the price. The cons of the game would maybe be the annoying beep when you ask for a tip and that you can't exit the game normally but you have to crash it instead.

This game is amazing. Full of vibrant colours, challenging puzzle and beautiful art style. However I was a bit dissapointed at the lack of levels. There are only five and that left me unsatisfied. I really do hope that more levels with be added in the future.

Fun, simple game. Totally worth the price, and some nice puzzles. Altough I had some troubles advancing, such as the '?' button not revealing every single thing do. Got stuck a couple times, but it was very entertaining. I just didn't like how the bug was so slow to walk through the scenarios.  Actually, I hate bugs. brrrrrrrrrr.
Visually appealing game, with a hidden object twist. Takes less than 2 hours to complete. Only objection is that moving your character is slow and unresponsive.
Hidden object games with puzzles,but it worth to play due nice graphic stylization,soundtrack and smooth gameplay. Gameplay is very relaxed and every screen is original and full of life.
Very beautiful game. Short and sweet. I got it for 25 cents, but it's worth the regular price.
Interesting art style. Worth the $2 asking price.
Very beautiful and calming game!
Nice game with long enough gameplay. Beautiful graphics and relaxing gameplay.
very chill but mindbending
Very nice to look at, but controls can be furstrating, lots of unintended moves that needs to be completed before you can attempt to move again.

I thought this was going to be a nice little Machinarium/Botanicula clone, but it turns out to be a hidden object game. It does have some puzzles as well, but most of our time playing was taken up with the object hunting. Hidden object games make me irritable, so the 'calming' music and slow pace that things happen are at odds with the mood the game puts me in. If you genuinely like hidden object games for reasons I cannot understand, you might like this, but I would not personally recommend it.

I want to like this, I really do. Decent music and vibrant art, but that alone does not make a game. When the gameplay is just a hidden object search with horrible tablet interface movement that is painfully slow between screens, I found it more monotonous than entertaining. This game could also be called 'How evolution does NOT work', though I know it's artsy and not intending to be accurate. If you can get under $1, sure, might be worth it. Any more? Don't waste your time or money.

Very nice music and atmosphere, but too short.  Also, since there were no instructions in the game itself except hints given sometimes, you may feel too frustrated when you can't figure out how a puzzle works.  ...Also. ._.  I thought that thing in the end    (guess it was a cave or something)    was a    HUMAN.    I thought that bug would transform into a    human    and I was like WOW for a moment.  Was a total disappointment. u.u    -But still! Puzzles were enjoyable somehow. :3 (Buy that on a discount if you will.) (I'm also sad that I have no trading cards though the game was over. u.u)
Oh wonderful, a glitchy find an object game for 5 god damn dollars.  11/10
The glitch at lvl 4 kind of ruined the game for me, but I liked it anyway.

+ visual stunning experience + nice idea  - short but kind of expensive (can be beaten under 2hours) - it missess story or something to make this game more friendly - cannot save your progress when not finished - cannot switch off the game, you have to crash it manually - controls could be better  However if you like puzzle, try it and ignore cons, decide for yourself if you like it or not.

Pros: -Beautiful art -Amazing soundtrack -Will present you with a fun, yet not frustratingly hard challenge  Cons: -Short, but I got it for .49 cents so I can't complain.  -Simple things like where to walk can be confusing   I rate it 7/10

Visually stunning short game. Some of the puzzles strain your brain a little, but the base gameplay of finding and collecting things is pretty relaxing. Takes less than two hours to beat, even if you get stuck a couple of times like me.
I started as a caterpillar, ended up being a grasshopper, nice way to get ahead in life

this a a very relaxing and short game. I personally really enjoyed it.  exept for that one final puzzle. really, ♥♥♥♥ that ♥♥♥♥ing puzzle. like half of the time I spent on this game is in that final puzzle.   but ignoring That One Puzzle, it is a cheap and very enjoyable game. if you have the money I recommend you buy it.

An interesting Hidden Object style game, though not one that's easy to recommend. The longer you play for, the more the small things irritate you. Like having to wait while your bug crawls ever-so-slowly across the screen to move to a new area, it's a dreadful new way of padding-out a game's length. If moving between screens was simply a matter of clicking arrows (like in most other HOG's) then you'd finish it 66% faster than it actually takes.  If you're short of patience i imagine it will drive you up the wall.   Also there is a lack of explanation for some of the puzzles leaving you clicking randomly all over the place until something changes and you can see what you're supposed to be doing.   It's not worth full-price but if you're a die-hard Hidden Object fan then pick it up in a sale.
Beautiful. 2hr point and click art show.
Great little puzzle game, looks absolutely stunning.
Art style and puzzles designed for a younger crowd. Only complaints are the repetitive musical score and the speed of the bugs. 7.8/10 Too much bugs.

this game is more of an experience than your ordinary p&c game it plays much like an ios game which is my main drawback about it but it compromise with its unusual graphics and astonishing artstyle I enjoyed it a lot!
I paid $0.19 for this game, and I ain't even mad.
Look, this game was never going to be mind blowingly awesome but It's a nice game that relaxes you, it's pretty and it's fun to play.  Plus it gives you an opportunity to use a 99 cents joke.

At $1 you can't go wrong (though I got this for like 30 cents during a weekly sale). It's a short hidden object game, only 5 levels, and quite relaxing...up until the final puzzle. I see others have made mention of the final puzzle as well. All the other puzzles are a breeze and shouldn't take much to get through, but the last one is a b****. It has 13 achievements and they are all easy to get, so if you are someone who likes 100% completing games, this one will make you happy.  3/5 stars from me.
Great artwork. Gameplay is not that great though. A simple hidden object game.
It is an interesting game.  The art style is uniqe. The puzzles can be irritating if you want to finish things quickly, but if you just sit down and really look at things, it is simple and elegant.

Morphopolis has some nice artwork but suffers from terrible usability issues.  Gameplay is 'Hidden Object' clicking; the objects are usually not very hidden at all, but they are progress-gated so that you cannot click on them until the game lets you.  Character movement is a nightmare. The game forces you to backtrack and just walking from screen to screen feels like a battle of wills.   A fullscreen puzzle on level 4 (flower pollen) cannot be exited without force-quitting the game and provides so little feedback that it caused an immediate flurry of users begging the devs to fix it upon release; over six months later there have been no updates.   I cannot recommend this at any price in its current state.

A beautiful game with nice pacing, a wonderful ability to show you what you need to do without words, and the the theme of transformation is very prevelant. The puzzles are a nice mix of medium to hard to solve.

It is simply not recommended to most people, but it's not that bad not to be recommended. Why ? If you're not into adventure games, this is not for you. If you are not into point and click, this is not for you. However, if you like beautiful painted pictures, watching small bugs interact, etc then give it a shot. But be mindful, it has no instructions whatsoever, nor it has a hint system - for me, it didn't work. you can either try to think your actions, or simply click like nuts around the screen .   It has trading cards, that go at around 0.08 /piece, maybe more, and it has easy achievements, that may be a plus point for some  Not recommended for 1 USD. I got it for around 30 cents, which I guess it is ok.
Okay, probably the weirdest game i have ever played.

full disclosure - i don't play hidden object games, and didn't realise this was one when i decided to play it next. i thought it was a puzzle game. i was wrong.  i won't criticise it for it's hidden object content (though i do not understand the appeal at all) as it's unfair to mark down a game for being the genre it is. however, the other aspects are incredibly frustrating. the character model moves so slowly, which feels like unnecessary padding. pathing is terrible. there's no indication of where you can and can't go, so you have to wait an eternity for the character model to walk to a point only to find you can't go that way. the game doesn't explain any of the mechanics or puzzles - not an issue for the most part, but in 2 instances i had no idea what i had to do to move the game along and had to look at a guide to simply progress the game (oh, that mechanic that i discovered by accident that did nothing now does something in select spots on one single level? ugh). that's not clever game design.  the puzzles were fairly bland - nothing that hasn't been done a million times before. but i have to mention the last one in the game...if you're colour blind, like i am - GOOD BLOODY LUCK. it was nearly impossible for me to distinguish some of the colours. terrible puzzle design.  the music is nice enough, but loops too soon.  visually - A+. absolutely beautiful to look at. just wish the graphics were married to a better game.

This game has very simple gameplay but yet it still has a few puzzles that really make you think. It can be confusing at times because of the lack of instructions. The artwork in this game is beautiful. At a cheap price it is a very relaxing game. The game takes about 2 hours to beat completely so it is very short. Overall I was pleasantly surprised with this game.
Very  beautiful game!

I'm not sure if I'm learning anything related to science or biology but the art is dope enough to keep you entertained through the puzzles. The game is short and it's a good decision as I'll puke if I'm gonna go through a few more hours of gameplay. And easy achievements!

I dont fancy insects myself, especially every end of the level they eat the insect's brain (Did they?) This game can give confusions, yet strangely addicting puzzles. Worth an hour or two of my life. 7/10 to play. Although theclimbing up and down could tick you off a little if you're an impatient person
Good but clueless
+Good art +Nice for chilling  -little short game  buyable with bundle and discount for steam cards

It's pretty, I guess, but so are lots of things. This is a poor hidden object game with different scenery. Instead of evil sorcerers, you have insects. Instead of a helpless girl or kid, you have an insect. Instead of monsters and unicorns, you have insects. It is vaguely interesting for a few minutes, then it gets tedious.
My entomophobia was cured.
Visually pleasing. Relaxing to play with the soothing soundtrack. Love for it to be longer and have more puzzles.
Visually stunning and wonderfully immersive, this is a nice, cheap, and fun game good for a few hours of casual brain teasing.

This game is a bug type Puzzle/Problem slover. It doesn't tell you anything about the puzzles, how to solve them, or anything such as that, which is an aspect of the game that I hate. If it gets too hard then there are guides to the game which I advise looking at. The game is a beautiful peice of PC harware. It's very beautiful and for an artist, it's eye candy. If you are looking for a short puzzler (Which I beat in under 2 hours) that is lovely, then try this game out.

Well its short, only 5 levels and its kinda easy. The plants remind me of the nausicaa anime movie. Point and click small puzzle, not much going for this game at all.  I would give a thumbs up if there was many more levels and puzzles.
Pretty, -pretty- game with very relaxing music. It was nice to just sit back and chill out with some simple puzzles.
Pros: Good visuals , Puzzles make you use your brain.  Cons: No guidance, music gets old fast. No settings  Also steam cards

This is the best hidden object game that I have ever played. It is beautiful and surprising and clever.  It is slow. It has hidden object elements. It is very linear.  But it was definitely worth 50 cents.
super gorgeous. nice little puzzles. worth the price.
Very short and at times a little confusing on a PC, but a solid couple of hours of insect-themed hidden object puzzles.

PROS - A point & click visual acid trip...WITH BUGS!! eeeeeyyewwwww!!   CONS- Short, and theres a glitch where the game minimizes and maximized real fast just about anytime you double click something fast  Overall good game 7/10
There two types of people in this world.  1.) Ew! Bugs!  2.) Cool! Bugs!
Really gorgeous art. Really cool.  There's just one flaw that it doesn't support 21:9 resoultion appropriately.
This game is such a beauty. Simple enough puzzles. Sluggish movement and hints when something is really well hidden. Best for a lazy afternoon.

Normally i tend to stay away from from the whole hidden item genre so I have no idea why I purchased this game to begin with. Maybe it was the gorgeous visuals, the intresting puzzles or just pure boredom.  Whatever it was I am very glad I made the purchase as I enjoyed this game immensely. However it is not without its flaws, firstly the movement of your little aphid is very awkward and slow. It takes some getting used to. Some puzzles are very frustrating not due to difficulty but to poor control. For example one puzzle sees you try to turn piles of seeds into 1 pile using checkers moves. It takes 3 or 4 swipes to make a move and makes what is a fairly simple puzzle a hard slog.   Final Rating 8/10
If you do mind spending money then buy this game because it is cheap and they are great puzzles to solve in this game. In my opinion it is probably the best puzzle solving game on Steam.
Beautiful colours and illustrations, nice chill music, very calming game. Highly recommended if you want something special.

This game is a beautiful work of art with quite a few challenging puzzles. Most puzzles are on the casual side but the game does throw a few challenges your way. For the most part, the game's best quality is the gorgeous artwork. So, if you like games that heavily rely on artwork to carry them through, then, you can't go wrong with this one. It's stunning to look at. The puzzles in general are so-so and are typical casual puzzles, but, the art is what truly makes this game pop. It's constantly on sale and you can often get it for a very cheap heavily discounted price, so, it's definitely worth getting.
Obviously, very nice-looking game. Simple point and click interface that is imprecise and sometimes does not register clicks. Errors began on the first screen. Too bad...
Morphopolis is a small but fun game with a pretty art style. it takes some time away and really needs you to think trough the levels  I had a lot of fun.
